Conda tutorial including Conda environments, Python packages, and PIP, Python and IPython in the command line, Jupyter notebook tutorial and Python crash course
column9: Assignment 2: Bash, Conda, IPython, and Jupyter

column7: Python scripts, error messages, printing strings and variables, strings and string operations, numbers and mathematical expressions, getting help with commands and Ipython

column7: Taking input, reading files, writing files, functions

column3: Logic, Loops, Lists, Dictionaries, and Tuples
column7: Logic and loops, lists and list comprehension, tuples, dictionaries, other types

Review of Python commands, IPython review -- enhanced interactive Python shells with support for data visualization, distributed and parallel computation and a browser-based notebook with support for code, text, mathematical expressions, inline plots and other rich media
Regular expression syntax, Command-line tools: `grep`, `sed`, `awk`, `perl -e`, Python examples: built-in and `re` module
Numpy, Pandas, and Matplotlib overview
Intro to NumPy and Pandas: `ndarray`, `Series`, `DataFrame`, `index`, `columns`, `dtypes`, `info`, `describe`, `read_csv`, `head`, `tail`, `loc`, `iloc`, `ix`, `to_datetime`

Data Analysis with Pandas: `concat`, `append`, `merge`, `join`, `set_option`, `stack`, `unstack`, `transpose`, dot-notation, `values`, `apply`, `lambda`, `sort_index`, `sort_values`, `to_csv`, `read_csv`, `isnull`
